intro: Eriogonum jonesii, commonly known as Jones' buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It has basal leaves that are often hairy and may have a reddish or purple tinge. Eriogonum jonesii is known for its adaptability to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
